intro: Eleiodoxa microcarpa, commonly known as the African nutmeg tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that turn from green to yellowish when mature. The seeds inside the fruits are encased in a hard shell and are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
